remarks: A set which is equipollent to the base set of a definable Abelian group is the base set of some (relabeled) Abelian group.  (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 8-Jul-2015.)
statement:
isnumbasgrplem1.b $e |- B = ( Base ` R ) $.
isnumbasgrplem1 $p |- ( ( R e. Abel /\ C ~~ B ) -> C e. ( Base " Abel ) ) $.
